title: Here's a reading list of 20 influential articles on zero- and few-shot learning using pre-trained language models (PLMs) up to 2022
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** by Jacob Devlin et al
This foundational paper introduces BERT, a model that has significantly influenced zero- and few-shot learning
**"Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"** by Tom B. Brown et al
This paper introduces GPT-3, demonstrating its few-shot learning capabilities
**"UnifiedQA: Crossing Format Boundaries with a Single QA System"** by Khashabi et al
Discusses a model that performs well on various QA formats with few-shot learning
**"T5: Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"** by Colin Raffel et al
Introduces T5, a model that can be adapted for zero- and few-shot learning tasks
**"Zero-Shot Text Classification with Generative Language Models"** by Yinfei Yang et al
Explores zero-shot text classification using generative models
**"Exploiting Cloze Questions for Few-Shot Text Classification and Natural Language Inference"** by Yin et al
Discusses using cloze questions for few-shot learning tasks
Pattern-Exploiting Training"** by Schick and Sch√ºtze
Introduces a method for few-shot learning using patterns and demonstrations
**"Making Pre-trained Language Models Better Few-shot Learners"** by Gao et al
Proposes methods to enhance few-shot learning capabilities of PLMs
**"Zero-Shot Learning with Common Sense Knowledge Graphs"** by Ma et al
Explores the use of knowledge graphs for zero-shot learning
**"Calibrate Before Use: Improving Few-Shot Performance of Language Models"** by Zhao et al
Discusses calibration techniques to improve few-shot learning
**"Prompting GPT-3 to be Reliable"** by Perez et al
Investigates methods to improve the reliability of GPT-3 in few-shot settings
**"Meta-Learning for Few-Shot Natural Language Processing: A Survey"** by Hospedales et al
A survey on meta-learning approaches for few-shot NLP tasks
**"Few-Shot Learning with Retrieval Augmented Language Models"** by Lewis et al
Combines retrieval mechanisms with PLMs for improved few-shot learning
**"Zero-Shot Learning with Synthesized Data"** by Wang et al
Discusses generating synthetic data for zero-shot learning
**"Improving Few-Shot Learning with Auxiliary Self-Supervised Tasks"** by Su et al
Explores the use of self-supervised tasks to enhance few-shot learning
**"Prompt-Based Few-Shot Text Classification with Pre-trained Language Models"** by Liu et al
Investigates prompt-based methods for few-shot text classification
**"Zero-Shot Learning with Pre-trained Language Models: A Survey"** by Wang et al
A comprehensive survey on zero-shot learning using PLMs
**"Few-Shot Learning with Pre-trained Language Models: A Survey"** by Sun et al
Surveys the landscape of few-shot learning with PLMs
**"Prompting for Zero-Shot Learning with Pre-trained Language Models"** by Liu et al
Discusses the use of prompts for zero-shot learning
**"Exploring the Limits of Zero-Shot Learning with Pre-trained Language Models"** by Zhang et al
Investigates the boundaries of zero-shot learning capabilities in PLMs
These articles provide a comprehensive overview of the advancements in zero- and few-shot learning using pre-trained language models up to
